name: High Plank
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a kneeling position on the floor. 
2. Place your hands directly under your shoulders, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
3. Step your feet back one at a time to extend your legs fully, keeping your toes and balls of your feet in contact with the floor.
4. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels, avoiding sagging your hips or raising them too high.
5. Engage your core by pulling your belly button in towards your spine.
6. Hold the position, keeping your gaze slightly ahead of your hands to maintain a neutral neck.
7. Focus on maintaining a straight line and steady breathing for the duration of the hold.
short_summary: The high plank is an isometric exercise that targets the core and upper body muscles by holding a straight body position supported by the arms.
